root: ^This demo shows how the system works.
^Stories are written in Ink, a narrative scripting language that lets you create branching conversations.

c-0: ^Great choice! Let me show you what makes this platform special.
c-1: ^Perfect! Choices are the heart of interactive narratives.

s: ^Client-side compilation** means .ink files load and compile in your browser - no build step needed!
^Modular structure** lets you split large stories into smaller files using INCLUDE statements.
^Dead end detection** helps you find missing content with a simple command.
^Image support** allows you to add diagrams and visuals to enhance your narrative.

c-2: ^Thanks for checking out the features! You can always come back to explore more.

choices_explained: ^Choices create branching paths through your story.
^Notice how your previous choice appears above this content? That's the choice indicator system!
^You can create multiple branches, loops, and complex narratives.

c-0: ^It helps readers remember the path they took through the story.

s: ^Selected choices** in blue (the one you picked)
^Choice history** preserved as you scroll back

c-0: ^This makes it easy to understand the story structure as you explore.

c-1: ^Hope this helped! See you back at the hub.

adding_images: ^Just add a diagram tag to any paragraph in your Ink file.
^Images are automatically loaded from the assets folder for your story.
^The system prepends your story ID, so you don't need to repeat it!

c-1: ^Glad you learned about adding images! See you next time.

organizing_content: ^For large stories, you can split content into multiple files.
^For example, a main file can include separate sections using the INCLUDE statement.
^Each section can be edited independently, making collaboration easier.
^The dead end analyzer helps you find missing content with the analyze-ink command.

c-0: ^It is! And it's all designed to make creating interactive content as simple as possible.
^Thanks for exploring! Head back anytime to learn more.
